title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties, centered around Jay Gatsby.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A story of racial injustice in the Deep South through a child's eyes.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian tale about totalitarianism and surveillance.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel about manners and social status.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A novel about the obsession of Captain Ahab with the white whale Moby-Dick.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about the teenage rebellion of Holden Caulfield.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a future where society is engineered into rigid social classes.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A novel about a young man who commits a murder and struggles with guilt.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem about the adventures of Odysseus on his journey home from the Trojan War.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel about the French invasion of Russia and its impact on Tsarist society.
